docs.title: DebugBox
docs.text:
A lightweight, variant-based debugging container suite for Kubernetes and Docker environments.

Choose exactly the right size for your debugging task — no bloat, no waiting.

Variant Size Best For Pull Command lite ~14 MB Network/DNS checks ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite balanced (default) ~46 MB Daily Kubernetes troubleshooting ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox power ~104 MB Packet capture & deep forensics ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power

Also available on Docker Hub: mibtisam/debugbox*

Supports amd64 and arm64 (Apple Silicon, Graviton, Raspberry Pi) out of the box.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Debug a running pod in seconds:

kubectl debug my-pod -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

Or launch a standalone session:

kubectl run debug --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --restart=Never

Now you're inside with curl, dig, tcpdump, vim, strace, and more.

→ Full quick start guide

docs.title: Why DebugBox?
docs.text:
Modern pods often lack basic tools:

kubectl exec -it my-pod -- curl
# curl: not found

Alternatives like netshoot are great but 201 MB — too heavy for simple checks.

DebugBox gives you three focused variants so you pull:

  • 14.4 MB for basic connectivity
  • 46.2 MB for daily debugging
  • 104 MB only when you need tshark or nftables

No bloat. No 200 MB waits. Just the right size for the job.

Faster pulls. Faster debugging.

Sizes measured via docker save | gzip -c | wc -c — reflects actual compressed download size from registry.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
DebugBox is a container image — no installation required.

Pull directly from either registry:

# GitHub Container Registry (recommended)
ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox            # balanced variant (default)
ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite
ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power

# Docker Hub (mirror)
docker.io/mibtisam/debugbox
docker.io/mibtisam/debugbox-lite
docker.io/mibtisam/debugbox-power

All images are multi-architecture manifests supporting linux/amd64 and linux/arm64.

Note: The unqualified name (debugbox) always refers to the balanced variant.

Quick Start → Try it now

docs.title: The Pain Point
docs.text:
You've probably seen this:

kubectl exec -it my-pod -- curl
# exec failed: "curl": executable file not found

Modern production containers (distroless, scratch, minimal Alpine) ship without basic debugging tools.

Existing solutions help, but:

  • netshoot: Great tools, but 201 MB — overkill for a simple curl
  • busybox: Tiny (1.5 MB), but lacks real debugging tools

docs.title: The DebugBox Solution
docs.text:
Three purpose-built variants so you pull only what you need:

Variant Size When to Use lite ~14 MB Quick network/DNS checks balanced ~46 MB Daily Kubernetes troubleshooting (default) power ~104 MB Deep forensics, packet capture

Result: Up to 4.3× faster pulls than alternatives for common cases.

docs.text: Feature DebugBox netshoot busybox Multiple size options ✓ (3 variants) ✗ ✗ Smallest option 14 MB 201 MB 1.5 MB Kubernetes-focused ✓ ✓ ✗ Multi-arch support ✓ ✓ ✓ Deterministic builds ✓ ✗ ✗ Security scanned ✓ (Trivy) ✗ ✗

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Real-world debugging scenarios using DebugBox.

docs.title: 1. Service Not Reachable?
docs.text:
kubectl run debug --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --restart=Never

# Inside
curl -v http://my-service.default.svc.cluster.local:8080
dig my-service.default.svc.cluster.local
nslookup my-service

docs.title: 2. Application Pod Network Issues
docs.text:
kubectl debug my-app -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

# Inside (same network as app)
curl -v localhost:8080/health
ss -tulnp | grep 8080
lsof -i :8080

docs.title: 3. Capture Traffic for Offline Analysis
docs.text:
kubectl run capture --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power --restart=Never

tcpdump -i eth0 -w /tmp/capture.pcap port 443 -c 500
# Ctrl+C, then:
kubectl cp capture:/tmp/capture.pcap ./capture.pcap -c capture

Or live analysis: 

tshark -i eth0 -f "port 443" -Y "http"

docs.title: 4. Node-Level Networking Problem
docs.text:
kubectl run node-debug --rm -it \
  --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power \
  --overrides='{"spec":{"hostNetwork":true}}' \
  --restart=Never

ip route
iptables -L -nv
nft list ruleset
conntrack -L

docs.title: 5. Trace Application System Calls
docs.text:
kubectl debug my-app -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

# Find PID
ps aux | grep myapp
# Trace network calls
strace -p 1234 -e trace=network -f

docs.title: 6. DNS Resolution Failure
docs.text:
kubectl run dns-check --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite --restart=Never

dig +short my-service.default.svc.cluster.local
cat /etc/resolv.conf
nslookup kubernetes.default

docs.title: 7. High Bandwidth Usage
docs.text:
kubectl run monitor --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --restart=Never

iftop -i eth0
# or per-connection
nload eth0

docs.title: 8. Network Performance Test
docs.text:
# Server
kubectl run iperf-server --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --command -- iperf3 -s

# Client (new terminal)
kubectl run iperf-client --rm --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --command -- iperf3 -c iperf-server.pod.ip -t 30

docs.title: 9. Inspect ConfigMap/Secret Content
docs.text: DebugBox does not include kubectl — it focuses purely on debugging tools inside the container.

docs.title: Option A: Pipe from Workstation (Recommended)
docs.text:
Run kubectl on your local machine and pipe into DebugBox:

kubectl get cm my-config -o yaml | \
  kubectl run tools --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite --restart=Never -- yq '.data'

For secrets: 

kubectl get secret my-tls -o jsonpath='{.data.tls\.crt}' | base64 -d | \
  kubectl run cert-view --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite --restart=Never -- openssl x509 -text -noout

docs.title: Option B: Mount Kubeconfig (Advanced)
docs.text:
If you need kubectl inside:

kubectl run tools --rm -it \
  --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-balanced \
  --overrides='{
    "spec": {
      "containers": [{
        "name": "tools",
        "volumeMounts": [{"name": "kubeconfig", "mountPath": "/root/.kube"}]
      }],
      "volumes": [{
        "name": "kubeconfig",
        "hostPath": {"path": "/root/.kube", "type": "Directory"}
      }]
    }
  }' \
  --restart=Never

Then inside: 

kubectl get cm my-config -o yaml | yq '.data'

Warning: This requires hostPath access and is not recommended in restricted clusters.

→ More usage patterns: Kubernetes Usage | Docker Usage

docs.title: Troubleshooting & FAQ
docs.text: Common issues, solutions, and frequently asked questions when using DebugBox.

docs.title: Image Pull Failures
docs.text:
Symptoms: ImagePullBackOff, ErrImagePull

Causes & Solutions:

  • Wrong tag/name: Verify exact image name 

    # Correct examples
ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox              # balanced
ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite
ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power:v1.0.0

  • GHCR authentication required (common in private clusters): Configure image pull secret for ghcr.io or use Docker Hub mirror: 

    --image=docker.io/mibtisam/debugbox

  • Network restrictions: Pre-pull on nodes or use internal mirror

docs.title: Tool Not Found (e.g., bash, tcpdump, vim)
docs.text:
Symptoms: command not found

Diagnosis & Solution:

Use the correct variant:

Missing Tool Required Variant Command Example bash, vim balanced+ ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox tcpdump, strace balanced+ ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox tshark, nftables power ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power

Lite only has ash, curl, dig, jq, yq.

docs.title: Permission Denied (tcpdump, raw sockets)
docs.text:
Symptoms: tcpdump: permission denied or similar

Cause: Missing Linux capabilities (NET_ADMIN, NET_RAW)

Solutions:

  • For ephemeral containers: Kubernetes drops capabilities by default in newer versions Use standalone pod instead: 

    kubectl run debug --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --restart=Never

  • Or add capabilities explicitly (requires cluster privileges): 

    kubectl debug my-pod -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --cap-add=NET_ADMIN,NET_RAW

docs.title: kubectl debug Not Working
docs.text:
Symptoms: Command fails or "debug subcommand not available"

Check:

kubectl version --short                  # Needs v1.23+
kubectl api-versions | grep debugging    # Should show debugging.k8s.io/v1

Alternative: Always use standalone pod: 

kubectl run debug --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --restart=Never

docs.title: Slow Image Pull
docs.text:
Solution: Use lite variant for fastest startup: 

--image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite   # ~14 MB

Pre-pull on nodes if recurring: 

kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{range .items[*]}{.metadata.name}{"\n"}{end}' | xargs -I{} kubectl ssh {} -- docker pull ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

docs.title: DNS Issues Inside Container
docs.text:
Symptoms: dig fails, no resolution

Check:

cat /etc/resolv.conf
  • In kubectl debug: Should match target pod (usually correct)
  • In standalone pod: Uses pod's DNS (cluster DNS)
  • If broken: May be cluster-wide CoreDNS issue

Test known-good domain: 

dig google.com

docs.title: Architecture Mismatch (arm64 nodes)
docs.text:
Symptoms: exec format error, image pull fails

Solution: DebugBox images are multi-arch — no special tag needed.

Verify node arch: 

kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{range .items[*]}{.metadata.name}{"\t"}{.status.nodeInfo.architecture}{"\n"}{end}'

All variants support amd64 and arm64.

docs.title: Container Exits Immediately
docs.text:
Cause: Missing -it or --rm with no TTY

Fix: Always include interactive flags: 

kubectl run debug --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --restart=Never

docs.title: Does DebugBox include kubectl?
docs.text:
No — intentionally.

DebugBox is a debugging toolbox, not a Kubernetes client. Including kubectl would:

  • Bloat image size
  • Duplicate your workstation capability
  • Encourage insecure control-plane access

Pattern: Run kubectl locally and pipe output: 

kubectl logs my-pod | kubectl run debug --rm -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --restart=Never -- cat

docs.title: Can I run non-root?
docs.text:
Yes, but many tools (tcpdump, strace) require root.

Override: 

docker run -it --rm --user 1000:1000 ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite

docs.title: Why no helm, k9s, etc.?
docs.text:
DebugBox is focused on low-level debugging — network, system, process. Deployment tools are out of scope to keep images small and secure.

→ See Variants Overview for tool breakdown

docs.title: Still Stuck?
docs.text:
• Review Examples
  • Check cluster logs: kubectl logs -n kube-system coredns-...
  • Open a GitHub issue with:
    • DebugBox variant/tag used
    • Kubernetes/Docker version
    • Exact command and error output

You're not alone — the community is here to help.

docs.title: Guarantees
docs.text:
• Deterministic: Critical tools (e.g., yq in power) are version-pinned and SHA-verified
  • Transparent: Only documented tools are included — no hidden packages
  • Secure by default: Scanned with Trivy on every release
  • Root access: All images run as root for full debugging capability (ephemeral use only)

docs.title: Multi-Architecture Support
docs.text: All DebugBox images are multi-platform manifests.

docs.title: Supported Architectures
docs.text:
• linux/amd64 (x86_64) — Intel/AMD servers, most VMs
  • linux/arm64 (aarch64) — Apple Silicon (M1–M4), AWS Graviton, Raspberry Pi 64-bit

docs.title: Automatic Selection
docs.text:
Docker, containerd, and Kubernetes automatically pull the correct architecture.

# Works seamlessly on both amd64 and arm64
docker pull ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox:latest
kubectl debug my-pod -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

No --platform flag needed.

docs.title: Explicit Platform (Rare)
docs.text: docker pull --platform linux/arm64 ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

docs.title: Verify Inside Container
docs.text:
uname -m
# x86_64 → amd64
# aarch64 → arm64

→ Variants Overview | Tooling Manifest →

docs.title: Security Policy
docs.text: DebugBox takes security seriously. All released images follow strict practices to minimize risk.

docs.title: Vulnerability Reporting
docs.text:
Do not open public GitHub issues for security vulnerabilities.

Please report privately via Email.

Subject: [SECURITY] DebugBox vulnerability: [brief description]

Include:

  • Description and steps to reproduce
  • Affected variant and version
  • Potential impact

We follow responsible disclosure:

  • Acknowledgment within 72 hours
  • Fix timeline based on severity
  • Patch released before public announcement
  • Credit given (if desired)

→ Full policy and GitHub Security Advisories: SECURITY.md on GitHub

docs.title: Automated Scanning
docs.text:
Every release is scanned with Trivy:

  • HIGH and CRITICAL vulnerabilities block release
  • Both amd64 and arm64 images scanned
  • Results logged in GitHub Actions

Local scanning: 

make scan

docs.title: Image Design
docs.text:
• Runs as root — required for tools like tcpdump, strace (ephemeral debugging only)
  • No baked-in secrets
  • Minimal variants — lite excludes compilers/runtimes
  • Pinned dependencies — critical tools version-locked and SHA-verified where possible

docs.title: Support Policy
docs.text:
From RELEASE.md:

Version Support Security Patches Current Full (12 months) All severities Previous (N-1) Security-only (6 months) HIGH/CRITICAL only Older Community/best-effort None guaranteed

docs.text:
• Pin versions in production: 
    ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox:v1.0.0
  • Use lite variant when possible (smallest attack surface)
  • Run in isolated namespaces
  • Delete debugging pods after use
  • Monitor GitHub releases and security advisories

docs.title: Docker Usage
docs.text: DebugBox integrates seamlessly with Docker for local development and container inspection.

docs.title: Interactive Session
docs.text: docker run -it --rm ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

docs.title: Share Another Container's Network
docs.text:
Inspect a running container's network namespace:

docker run -it --rm \
  --net container:my-app-container \
  ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

# Inside — same network as my-app-container
curl localhost:8080
netstat -tulpn

docs.title: Host Network Access
docs.text:
Debug the Docker host directly:

docker run -it --rm --net host ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

# Inside — host network context
ip route
iptables -L

docs.title: Volume Mount for Artifacts
docs.text:
Save captures or logs to host:

docker run -it --rm -v $(pwd)/captures:/captures ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power

# Inside
tcpdump -i eth0 -w /captures/traffic.pcap

docs.title: Docker Compose Sidecar
docs.text:
services:
  app:
    image: nginx:alpine
    ports: ["80:80"]

  debugbox:
    image: ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox
    network_mode: service:app
    command: sleep infinity
    tty: true

Then: 

docker compose exec debugbox bash
curl localhost:80

docs.title: Kubernetes Usage
docs.text: DebugBox is designed for Kubernetes-native debugging workflows.

docs.title: Debug a Running Pod (Recommended)
docs.text:
kubectl debug my-pod -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox

Shares network and process namespace with the target pod.

Target specific container in multi-container pod: 

kubectl debug my-pod -it --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox --target=sidecar

docs.title: Standalone Debugging Pod
docs.text:
kubectl run debug --rm -it \
  --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox \
  --restart=Never

docs.title: Node-Level Debugging
docs.text:
kubectl run debug-node --rm -it \
  --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox \
  --overrides='{"spec":{"hostNetwork":true, "nodeName":"my-node"}}' \
  --restart=Never

docs.title: Persistent Sidecar Pattern
docs.text:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: app-with-debug
spec:
  containers:
  - name: app
    image: nginx:alpine
  - name: debugbox
    image: ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox
    command: ["sleep", "infinity"]

Access: 

kubectl exec -it app-with-debug -c debugbox -- bash

docs.title: Variant Recommendations
docs.text:
• lite: Fast DNS/network checks
  • balanced (default): Most debugging tasks
  • power: When you need tshark, nftables, or ltrace

→ Real-world debugging recipes: Examples

docs.title: Balanced Variant (Recommended)
docs.text:
~46 MB — The sweet spot for daily debugging.

The balanced variant is the default and recommended choice for nearly all troubleshooting tasks.

docs.title: When to Use Balanced
docs.text:
Ideal for:

  • Debugging running application pods (kubectl debug)
  • Daily Kubernetes workflows
  • Process, network, and system inspection
  • When you're unsure — start here

Upgrade to power only if you need packet analysis or advanced routing tools.

docs.title: Lite Variant
docs.text:
~14 MB — Minimal and lightning-fast.

The lite variant is optimized for scenarios where pull speed and image size matter most.

docs.title: When to Use Lite
docs.text:
Perfect for:

  • Quick network or DNS checks during incidents
  • Ephemeral debugging in bandwidth-constrained environments
  • Init containers or fast pod startup
  • When you only need basic connectivity tools

Avoid lite if you need tcpdump, strace, vim, or Kubernetes context switching.

docs.title: Key Tools
docs.text:
Category Tools Networking curl, netcat-openbsd, iproute2, iputils, bind-tools (dig, nslookup) Data jq, yq (Alpine package) Shell ash (BusyBox)

kubectl run debug-lite --rm -it \
  --image=ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite \
  --restart=Never

yq '.metadata.name' config.yaml

docs.title: Variants Overview
docs.text:
DebugBox provides three purpose-built variants so you pull only what you need.

Variant Size Best For Pull Command lite ~14 MB Quick network/DNS checks ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-lite balanced (default) ~46 MB Daily Kubernetes troubleshooting ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox power ~104 MB Deep forensics & packet analysis ghcr.io/ibtisam-iq/debugbox-power

Recommendation: Start with balanced — it's the default and covers 90% of use cases.

docs.title: Choosing the Right Variant
docs.text:
• Use lite when pull speed is critical (e.g., incident response, constrained bandwidth)
  • Use balanced for general debugging (recommended default)
  • Use power only when you need advanced tools like tshark, nftables, or ltrace

docs.title: Detailed Pages
docs.text:
• Lite Variant → — Minimal & fast
  • Balanced Variant → — Recommended daily driver
  • Power Variant → — Full SRE toolkit

docs.title: Power Variant
docs.text:
~104 MB — Full SRE-grade forensics toolkit.

The power variant includes everything from balanced, plus advanced tools for deep investigation.

docs.title: When to Use Power
docs.text:
Use only when you need:

  • Detailed packet analysis (tshark)
  • Library-level tracing (ltrace)
  • Firewall/routing debugging (nftables, bird, conntrack-tools)
  • Custom Python scripting (pip3)
  • High-precision network testing

Do not use power for routine tasks — stick with balanced to save time and bandwidth.
